title: Commuter makes truly stomach churning discovery in fellow passenger's bag
text:
News Commuter makes truly stomach churning discovery in fellow passenger's bag The train traveller records a video of belongings infested with crawling bugs in busy carriage in Chicago, Illinois Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now   Thank you for subscribing!   
A commuter makes a stomach-churning discovery when he peers into another passenger's bag and finds it is alive with crawling bugs. 
The train traveller recorded a video of the infested belongings, which US rail chiefs said belonged to a homeless person. 
A large plastic bag contains what looks like a blanket that on closer inspection is overrun with scurrying mites in footage shot in Chicago, Illinois. 
The grim discovery on Friday led to the Windy City's transport officials taking the carriage out of service for a top to bottom disinfection, reports NBC Chicago . The bug infestation in a passenger's bag on a busy commuter train in Chicago (Photo: philagon/Youtube) Read More 
A Chicago Transit Authority statement read: "When the CTA received a report of pests on a red line train on Friday, the rail car was immediately removed from service as a precautionary measure and received preventative treatment by an exterminator. "At this time, there is no confirmation that the pests depicted on the video are bed bugs. "While providing more than 700,000 rail rides each day, CTA takes reported incidents of uncleanliness, including those regarding pests, very seriously. Read More 
"We have a rigorous process to maintain cleanliness on our system and our bus and trains are cleaned daily, both before and after each trip, and at the end of each day. "Vehicles also receive thorough, deep cleanings on a regular basis that includes preventative treatment for pests." Like us on Facebook
